abstract: Website run by Johns Hopkins University's US-Korea institute charges that North Korean pesticide factory may be used to produce biological weapons; claim are based on photos of Kim Jong-un’s visit to Pyongyang Biotechnical Institute, where he examined equipment allegedly used to make military-size batches of anthrax.
lead_paragraph: A pesticide factory recently visited by the North Korean leader Kim Jong-un may be used to produce biological weapons, like anthrax, according to an online report.

headline.main: North Korea: Pesticide Factory May Have Sinister Purpose, Report Says
headline.print_headline: Asia | North Korea: Pesticide Factory May Have Sinister Purpose, Report Says

snippet: A pesticide factory recently visited by the North Korean leader Kim Jong-un may be used to produce biological weapons, like anthrax, according to an online report.
